general_titles: Cal Poly and Cal Maritime Integration Information
general_texts:
The California State University (CSU) system is in transition to 22 universities. California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo and California State University Maritime Academy (Cal Maritime) are integrating into one university with two locations. The maritime campus in Solano County will be known as Cal Poly Solano Campus and will house the Cal Poly Maritime Academy. The first Cal Poly Maritime Academy and Cal Poly Solano Campus students enrolling as Cal Poly students will take place in fall of 2026.


For integration updates, visit our Maritime Integration page.
Refer to the CSU Maritime Academy catalog for a full description of the program and degree requirements. Refer to the Admissions Office website for admission requirements and information.
A cumulative GPA of 2.00 is required for the lower division major requirements.

The Bachelor of Science in Business Administration requires a minimum of 120 units consisting of general education, major, and graduation requirements. This agreement only lists the lower division major requirements that may be fulfilled at the community college.


﻿The program emphasizes a balanced approach, combining deep theoretical knowledge with immersive experiential learning, all while fostering strong ethical values and global leadership capabilities. Students thrive in an environment that offers career development, close engagement with industry partners, hands-on learning opportunities, opportunities for travel, and exposure to a wide range of ideas and backgrounds.

general_titles: Cal Poly and Cal Maritime Integration Information
general_texts:
The California State University (CSU) system is in transition to 22 universities. California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo and California State University Maritime Academy (Cal Maritime) are integrating into one university with two locations. The maritime campus in Solano County will be known as Cal Poly Solano Campus and will house the Cal Poly Maritime Academy. The first Cal Poly Maritime Academy and Cal Poly Solano Campus students enrolling as Cal Poly students will take place in fall of 2026.


For integration updates, visit our Maritime Integration page.
Refer to the CSU Maritime Academy Catalog for a full description of the program and degree requirements. Refer to the Admission Office website for admission requirements and information.

The Bachelor of Science in Facilities Engineering Technology requires a minimum of 153 units consisting of general education, major and graduation requirements. This agreement only lists the lower division major requirements that may be taken at the community college.


The curriculum provides a foundation in the fundamentals of mechanical and electrical system engineering, as well as practical training in the operation and maintenance of real-world commercial and industrial facilities. The FET curriculum includes three 60-day practical training experiences; one sea training period aboard Training Ship Golden Bear and two industry co-operative education opportunities. The FET program also requires satisfactory completion of a qualifying examination administered by the Association for Facilities Engineering (AFE) to become a Certified Plant Engineer-in-Training (CPE-IT).
A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.00 is required for the lower division major requirements listed in the Lower Division Major Requirements Area > Section B.
Calculus I is required for this major. It is highly recommended for students to enroll in a pre-calculus course before transferring. See Calculus Prerequisite Courses section.

general_titles: Cal Poly and Cal Maritime Integration Information
general_texts:
The California State University (CSU) system is in transition to 22 universities. California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo and California State University Maritime Academy (Cal Maritime) are integrating into one university with two locations. The maritime campus in Solano County will be known as Cal Poly Solano Campus and will house the Cal Poly Maritime Academy. The first Cal Poly Maritime Academy and Cal Poly Solano Campus students enrolling as Cal Poly students will take place in fall of 2026.


For integration updates, visit our Maritime Integration page.
Refer to the CSU Maritime Academy catalog for a full description of the program and degree requirements. Refer to the Admissions Office website for admission requirements and information.

The Bachelor of Arts in International Security and Strategy requires a minimum of 120 units consisting of general education, major, and graduation requirements. This agreement only lists the lower division major requirements.﻿


Our unique curriculum is focused on equipping future leaders to tackle the most important international security and policy challenges of our time, from energy and environmental security to maritime and cybersecurity issues. Students will build skills in oral and written communication, critical thinking, problem solving, leadership development, policy analysis, research methods, and quantitative analysis.

general_titles: Cal Poly and Cal Maritime Integration Information
general_texts:
The California State University (CSU) system is in transition to 22 universities. California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo and California State University Maritime Academy (Cal Maritime) are integrating into one university with two locations. The maritime campus in Solano County will be known as Cal Poly Solano Campus and will house the Cal Poly Maritime Academy. The first Cal Poly Maritime Academy and Cal Poly Solano Campus students enrolling as Cal Poly students will take place in fall of 2026.


For integration updates, visit our Maritime Integration page.

Refer to the CSU Maritime Academy catalog for a full description of the program and degree requirements. Refer to the Admissions Office website for admission requirements and information.

﻿

The Bachelor of Science in Marine Engineering Technology requires 158 units consisting of general education, major, and graduation requirements. This agreement only lists the lower division major courses that may be taken at the community college. Due to STCW requirements, some lower division courses in the major must be completed at Cal Maritime. 


The curriculum provides a foundation in the engineering fundamentals of shipboard mechanical and electrical systems, as well as practical training in the operation and maintenance of steam, motor, and gas turbine propulsion plants. The MET curriculum includes three 60-day practical training experiences; two sea training periods aboard Training Ship Golden Bear and one sea training period aboard a military or commercial vessel. The MET program also requires satisfactory completion of a qualifying examination administered by the U.S. Coast Guard to become a Third Assistant Engineer, Steam and Motor Vessels, Unlimited Horsepower.
A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.00 is required for the lower division major requirements listed in the Lower Division Major Requirements Area > Section B.
Calculus I is required for this major. It is highly recommended for students to enroll in a pre-calculus course before transferring. See Calculus Prerequisite Courses section.

general_titles: Cal Poly and Cal Maritime Integration Information
general_texts:
The California State University (CSU) system is in transition to 22 universities. California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo and California State University Maritime Academy (Cal Maritime) are integrating into one university with two locations. The maritime campus in Solano County will be known as Cal Poly Solano Campus and will house the Cal Poly Maritime Academy. The first Cal Poly Maritime Academy and Cal Poly Solano Campus students enrolling as Cal Poly students will take place in fall of 2026.


For integration updates, visit our Maritime Integration page.

The Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation requires a minimum of 148 units consisting of general education, major, and graduation requirements. Due to STCW requirements, some lower division courses in the major must be completed at Cal Maritime. 



﻿The MT curriculum includes three practical training experiences: two sea training periods aboard the Training Ship GOLDEN BEAR, and one sea training period aboard a military or commercial vessel. The MT program also requires satisfactory completion of a qualifying examination administered by the U.S. Coast Guard to obtain a Third Mate, Unlimited, Any Ocean license, which is essential to gaining employment as a licensed deck officer on a commercial vessel. This agreement only lists the lower division major requirements. Due to STCW requirements, all lower division courses in the major must be completed at Cal Maritime. The courses below are recommended in order to fulfill GE requirements and/or upper division course prerequisites in the major.
Refer to the CSU Maritime Academy Catalog for a full description of the program and degree requirements. Refer to the Admissions Office website for admission requirements and information.

general_titles: Cal Poly and Cal Maritime Integration Information
general_texts:
The California State University (CSU) system is in transition to 22 universities. California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo and California State University Maritime Academy (Cal Maritime) are integrating into one university with two locations. The maritime campus in Solano County will be known as Cal Poly Solano Campus and will house the Cal Poly Maritime Academy. The first Cal Poly Maritime Academy and Cal Poly Solano Campus students enrolling as Cal Poly students will take place in fall of 2026.


For integration updates, visit our Maritime Integration page.

The Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (general option) requires a minimum of 146 units consisting of general education, major and graduation requirements. The courses below are recommended in order to fulfill GE requirements and/or upper division course prerequisites for the Mechanical Engineering B.S. non license program only.


The mission of the Mechanical Engineering program is to produce entry-level professionals capable of applying their knowledge of science and engineering in the design, analysis, evaluation, and production of engineering devices and systems. It also provides students with the necessary academic preparation for further education and professional development in their chosen career.
Refer to the CSU Maritime Academy catalog for a full description of the program and degree requirements. Refer to the Admission Office website for admission requirements and information.
A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 is required for the lower division requirements for this major. All transferable courses must be completed with a C- average or higher.

majors.major: Mechanical Engineering, U.S. Coast Guard License, B.S.
general_titles: Cal Poly and Cal Maritime Integration Information
general_texts:
The California State University (CSU) system is in transition to 22 universities. California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo and California State University Maritime Academy (Cal Maritime) are integrating into one university with two locations. The maritime campus in Solano County will be known as Cal Poly Solano Campus and will house the Cal Poly Maritime Academy. The first Cal Poly Maritime Academy and Cal Poly Solano Campus students enrolling as Cal Poly students will take place in fall of 2026.


For integration updates, visit our Maritime Integration page.
Refer to the CSU Maritime Academy catalog for a full description of the program and degree requirements. Refer to the Admission Office website for admission requirements and information.

The Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering carries a Third Assistant Engineer's License in partnership with the U.S. Coast Guard. The degree requires a minimum of 171 units consisting of general education, major and graduation requirements. Due to STCW requirements, some lower division courses in the major must be completed at Cal Maritime. 


﻿The mission of the Mechanical Engineering program is to produce entry-level professionals capable of applying their knowledge of science and engineering in the design, analysis, evaluation, and production of engineering devices and systems. It also provides students with the necessary academic preparation for further education and professional development in their chosen career.
A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher is required for the lower division requirements for this major. All transferable courses must be completed with a C-average or higher.
